title: Missiles, radars & loiter munition: Centre clears mega Rs 79K cr defence deal; what's on list
content: The Defence Acquisition Council has approved capital acquisition proposals totaling approximately Rs 79,000 crore to enhance the operational capabilities of the Armed Forces. These approvals, granted on December 29, 2025, cover a variety of equipment for the Army, Navy, and Air Force, including loiter munition systems, radars, guided rocket ammunition, and drone detection systems.

title: Live-fire war games: China launches drills around Taiwan; Taipei mobilises forces
content: China launched large-scale live-fire military drills around Taiwan, deploying warships and aircraft in a stern warning to independence supporters and foreign powers. Taiwan's military is on high alert, vowing to defend its democracy amid drills aimed at blockading key ports and simulating strikes.

title: 'Abysmal record': India flays Pak over attacks on minorities; refutes charges
content: Ministry of external affairs has rejected Pakistan's accusations of attacks on minorities, labeling them as "finger pointing" and highlighting Pakistan's "abysmal record" on the issue. The MEA stated that Pakistan's "horrific and systemic victimisation of minorities" is a well-established fact, refuting claims made by Pakistan's foreign affairs spokesperson.

title: Tesla 2008 crises: 'Angry' Musk told execs to get divorced if not happy
content: Newly surfaced footage from 2008 reveals Elon Musk's intense ultimatum to Tesla executives amidst near-bankruptcy. Facing a crisis with defective Roadster parts and a fleet of rejected cars, Musk demanded immediate solutions, stating, "If somebody can't get happy, get divorced." This period, described as 'pedal to the metal,' saw both Tesla and SpaceX on the brink of collapse.

title: No war in Pawar 'parivar': From split to civic poll pact - the NCP saga explained
content: The Ajit Pawar-led NCP and the Sharad Pawar faction will contest local elections in Pimpri-Chinchwad and Pune together. This alliance is a local arrangement for the civic polls. The decision was made after consulting party workers. This development has raised questions within the Maha Vikas Aghadi alliance.

title: Cargo ship or warship? China's sinister Taiwan war plan revealed - see pics
content: China is transforming its cargo ship, Zhongda 79, into an arsenal ship, equipping it with containerized launchers for up to 60 missiles. This upgrade, featuring advanced weaponry including hypersonic missiles, signifies Beijing's push to bolster its naval capabilities and match the US Navy's vertical launch systems. The vessel's transformation highlights China's growing maritime ambitions.

title: 'More autographs than runs' - Aus opener's self-deprecating post goes viral
content: Australian opener Jake Weatherald humorously acknowledged his tough Ashes form with a self-deprecating social media post after the MCG Test concluded swiftly.  Despite scoring low, his positive attitude earned fan support.  The ICC deemed the pitch "unsatisfactory" as Australia secured the Ashes urn ahead of the Sydney finale.

title: ‘AI agents are becoming a problem’: OpenAI CEO flags risks; offers $555K role
content: OpenAI is hiring a high-paid Head of Preparedness amid growing fears of AI systems exploiting security flaws and harming mental well-being. CEO Sam Altman acknowledged models are finding critical vulnerabilities, while also highlighting AI's potential psychological impact. The role will tackle cybersecurity, biosecurity, and self-improving AI risks, a crucial step as AI's dual nature becomes apparent.

title: Kishan, Pant or Jurel: Who will be KL Rahul’s backup for NZ ODIs
content: With KL Rahul set to be India’s first-choice wicketkeeper, the battle for his backup has intensified ahead of the New Zealand ODIs. Ishan Kishan’s red-hot domestic form, Rishabh Pant’s experience and Dhruv Jurel’s consistency have turned the second wicketkeeper’s slot into a key selection dilemma as India fine-tune their white-ball plans

title: Suriname stabbing: Suspect dies by suicide in custody; had killed 9 people including children
content: A man suspected of a horrific knife attack that claimed nine lives, including five children, in Suriname has died by suicide in police custody. The 43-year-old was found hanged in his cell. The violence, which reportedly followed a domestic dispute, has deeply shocked the nation, prompting a message of solidarity from the President.

title: Top 5 NBA career earners: LeBron James, Stephen Curry & more
content: The NBA's highest earners are leveraging talent, health, and strategic contract negotiations to amass fortunes. LeBron James leads with $581 million, followed by Stephen Curry ($532 million), Devin Booker ($520 million), Paul George ($516 million), and Anthony Davis ($511 million). These players demonstrate how modern contracts and business acumen have redefined success in the league.

title: Databricks CEO Bubble Warning: Ghodsi warns AI valuations are unsustainable
content: Databricks CEO Ali Ghodsi warns of an AI bubble, highlighting companies with billions in valuation but no revenue. He criticizes circular financing deals inflating valuations and predicts worsening market conditions. Ghodsi remains optimistic about AI agents, noting their significant use in database creation on Databricks, but sees revenue potential in applications, not commoditized foundation models.

title: World champ at 7; 'nervous' while meeting PM Modi: How Pragnika became chess prodigy
content: Seven-year-old Pragnika Vaka Lakshmi, Under-7 Girls champion at the FIDE World Schools Chess Championship 2025, met PM Narendra Modi after winning gold for India on Friday. From learning chess during COVID to rapid success, she shows rare courage and discipline. Backed by family sacrifices, scholarships, and offline coaching, she balances school, training, and dreams of becoming the best chess player worldwide.

title: Persistent bad breath could be a warning sign of colon cancer: Experts explains
content: Emerging studies reveal a concerning link between persistent bad breath and colon cancer. Gastroenterologist Dr. Joseph Salhab highlighted that the bacteria Fusobacterium nucleatum, found in the mouth, has been discovered in colon cancer tumors. This bacteria can travel to the intestines, promoting cancer cell growth and spread, suggesting oral hygiene is crucial for gut health.

title: 'Stand committed': Forest min reacts to SC Aravalli ruling; what he said on mining
content: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav welcomed the Supreme Court's decision to stay its order on the Aravalli range's "new definition." The court has formed a committee to re-examine the issues. The government remains committed to protecting and restoring the Aravalli hills, with mining bans on new and renewed leases continuing. This follows widespread criticism of the previous definition.

title: Travis Kelce: I let Andy Reid down during Chiefs' tough season
content: Kansas City Chiefs fans experienced an unfamiliar season of losses and missed playoffs in 2025, a stark contrast to years of dominance.  Veteran Travis Kelce expressed deep disappointment, feeling he let down coach Andy Reid, highlighting their strong bond and his unwavering sense of responsibility to the team and his mentor.

title: MLB trade rumors: Mets eye $10M Phillies star; Brandon Nimmo in focus
content: The New York Mets are reportedly signing veteran outfielder Max Kepler to a one-year deal, aiming for a cost-effective solution after trading Brandon Nimmo. Kepler offers defensive reliability and left-handed power, fitting the Mets' strategy of maintaining roster stability and payroll flexibility while preparing for top prospect Carson Benge's eventual rise.

title: Don’t go to Harvard for STEM: Malcolm Gladwell’s warning explained
content: Gladwell's “don’t go to Harvard for STEM” line is less a rule than a reminder about fit. In cohorts, even capable students can start feeling behind, and that feeling can push them out of science. Today, a degree is only the starting point; projects, research and skills matter just as much. Choose an environment that supports you while you grow.

title: OTD: Gavaskar's 236* — a day after overtaking Bradman — rewrote Indian Test history
content: On this day in 1983, batting legend Sunil Gavaskar etched his name in history with a monumental 236 not out against the West Indies in Chennai. This stellar innings followed his record-breaking 30th Test century, surpassing Don Bradman's long-standing mark. Gavaskar's unbeaten 236 remained India's highest Test score for nearly two decades, a testament to his enduring brilliance.

title: Confirmed: Kohli to play 3rd Vijay Hazare Trophy match for Delhi; date, venue revealed
content: While the BCCI has mandated centrally contracted players to feature in at least two matches, Virat Kohli has opted to play a third game as part of his preparation for the upcoming home series against New Zealand. Kohli has been in fine form in his first two appearances for Delhi, scoring 131 and 77 respectively.

title: When is the next full moon in 2026: Full moon dates and timings
content: The next full moon in 2026 is detailed for India. Full moons occur when Earth is between the Sun and Moon, fully illuminating the Moon's face. This celestial event happens approximately every 29.5 days. The article lists all full moon dates for 2026, adjusted for Indian Standard Time, offering a guide for sky gazers.

title: Stefon Diggs looks for Cardi B after Patriots’ 42–10 win over Jets
content: New England Patriots star Stefon Diggs searched for his partner Cardi B after a decisive win against the New York Jets. This public display of affection garnered varied reactions online. Some praised the gesture as loving, while others questioned its authenticity. The couple had reportedly spent Christmas apart, making their reunion notable.

title: Happy new year 2026: Top 100 wishes, quotes to share with your loved ones
content: As December concludes, the world anticipates New Year's Eve, a global celebration of fresh starts and renewed hope. Traditions vary, from Spain's 12 grapes to Denmark's plate-throwing, all emphasizing connection and togetherness. The article offers wishes and quotes to share this spirit of healing and opportunity.

title: 'I'll ensure Sengar gets death': Unnao rape survivor after SC ruling, says fight still on
content: The Unnao rape survivor expressed joy and vowed to pursue capital punishment after the Supreme Court stayed the Delhi High Court's order suspending expelled BJP leader Kuldeep Singh Sengar's life sentence. The apex court's decision prevents Sengar's release, emphasizing the peculiar circumstances of his conviction for a grave offense. The survivor conveyed her faith in the judiciary's pursuit of justice.

title: Operation Sindoor and beyond: How India prepared for future wars in 2025
content: India showcased its military prowess in 2025, marked by Operation Sindoor's decisive response to the Pahalgam attack. The year emphasized reforms, jointness, and technological adaptation, backed by a significant defence budget increase. Exercises and acquisitions highlighted preparedness for high-intensity conflicts, projecting strength and strategic vision across domains.

title: Bruins linked to 25-year-old Maple Leafs forward amid trade buzz
content: Boston Bruins are in a slump, losing five straight and prompting management to seek significant roster upgrades.  Interest is reportedly high in Toronto Maple Leafs winger Matias Maccelli, who could provide offensive depth and fit the team's long-term plans. Calgary Flames defenseman Rasmus Andersson is also being considered to bolster the defense and power play.

title: 'Unsatisfactory' pitch: Will MCG face ban after demerit point? What ICC rule says
content: "The pitch at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, the venue for the fourth Ashes Test, has been deemed ‘Unsatisfactory’ with the venue handed one demerit point under the ICC Pitch and Outfield Monitoring Process," the ICC said in a statement. An unsatisfactory rating is the third level in the ICC’s four-tier system.

title: Gold, silver price today: How much these precious metals cost in your city
content: Silver experienced a record-breaking rally, hitting fresh highs on strong investor demand and global cues, though it saw a dip as investors booked profits. Gold prices remained near record levels domestically, while overseas markets saw minor declines due to profit-taking.  Local prices for both precious metals are also provided.

title: IPO review: Only half of total listings end positively in '25— Check details
content: India's 2025 IPO market saw record fundraising but a reality check emerged as many stocks failed to sustain initial hype. While 69 companies listed above issue prices, only 54 remained positive by year-end. Experts advise investors to focus on fundamentals and track post-listing performance, especially for smaller issues, as quality is now being differentiated from mere sentiment.

title: 'No one coming to my cafe': Bareilly cafe owner says business hit after mob attacks bday party
content: Bareilly Cafe owner Shailendra Gangwar reports his business has stopped after right-wing activists disrupted a private birthday party. The activists allegedly assaulted guests and raised slogans of 'love jihad'. Police initially fined some individuals but later registered a case against the attackers. The incident has caused financial and reputational damage to the cafe.

title: 'We are worried': What SC said on convict Sengar's bail; the 'public servant' question
content: The Supreme Court has intervened in the Unnao rape case. It has halted the Delhi high court's decision to suspend former BJP leader Kuldeep Singh Sengar's life sentence. The apex court is examining if an MLA qualifies as a public servant under the POCSO Act. This move ensures Sengar remains in jail. The survivor welcomes the Supreme Court's action.

title: 5 hidden beaches to visit in India for some peace in 2026
content: Escape the crowds and discover India's serene hidden beaches in 2026. From Goa's Butterfly Beach to Odisha's Chandipur, these tranquil shores offer a peaceful retreat. Lakshadweep's Minicoy, Karnataka's Om Beach, and Kerala's Perumathura also provide unhurried moments by the sea, perfect for rejuvenation and quiet contemplation away from the usual tourist hustle.

title: Horror on Nainital highway: Scrap truck topples onto Bolero, crushing UP power dept driver
content: A driver for the Uttar Pradesh power department was killed when a truck carrying wooden scrap overturned on the Nainital Highway in Rampur. The truck rammed a divider while trying to avoid the Bolero, crushing it completely. The driver, Firasat, was pulled from the wreckage but declared dead at the hospital.

title: Dhurandhar: Naseem Mughal on viral assault scene with Ranveer Singh
content: Naseem Mughal, who plays Lulli in 'Dhurandhar', initially refused to shoot an intense assault scene with Ranveer Singh due to nervousness. However, the film's team and Singh himself made him comfortable, allowing him to deliver a powerful performance that has since gone viral.

title: Bengaluru businessman held for duping woman of Rs 75 lakh; rapes her minor sister
content: Bagalagunte police arrested Subham Shukla, a 27-year-old textile businessman. He is accused of cheating a woman of gold and cash exceeding Rs 75 lakh. Shukla also allegedly raped her 16-year-old sister. The victims' father filed the complaint. Shukla has been remanded in judicial custody. Investigations are ongoing.

title: Silver prices drop Rs 21,000 in an hour after hitting life-time high
content: Silver price crash today: Silver prices saw a sharp drop after hitting record highs, with MCX futures plunging Rs 21,000 per kg as profit booking set in amid easing geopolitical risks and higher margin requirements.

title: Unnao rape case: SC stays Delhi HC order granting bail to Kuldeep Sengar; ex-BJP MLA to remain in jail
content: The Supreme Court has halted the Delhi High Court's bail order for ex-BJP MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar in the Unnao rape case.  The apex court questioned the suspension of his sentence, noting Sengar remains jailed for another conviction. The CBI had appealed the bail, highlighting the horrific nature of the crime against a minor.

title: IT hiring in 2025: The boom is real, but not the one engineering students were waiting for
content: India’s IT job market is growing again in 2025, but the recovery looks different from the one engineering students were expecting. Hiring is rising, yet employers are prioritising experienced professionals, niche digital skills, and immediate readiness over mass campus recruitment. For fresh graduates, the boom exists—but its doors are narrower, and entry requires more than a degree.

title: World record! Bhutan bowler scripts history; becomes first to do the unthinkable
content: Bhutan's Sonam Yeshey made T20 International history by becoming the first bowler to take an eight-wicket haul, finishing with figures of 8 for 7 against Myanmar. This extraordinary spell dismantled Myanmar's chase, securing an 82-run victory for Bhutan and an unassailable series lead. Yeshey's performance surpasses all previous T20 International records.

title: 'Why are you attacking Hindus in B'desh?': Bengal vendor assaulted by mob in Odisha; rescued by cops
content: A street vendor from West Bengal, Arshad Mallik, was brutally assaulted and accused of being an illegal Bangladeshi migrant in Odisha.  He was rescued by police after a video of the incident went viral.  With assistance from a state minister and local police, Mallik was safely brought back home.

title: 'Horrific': Rahul condemns Tripura student's killing in Dehradun; accuses BJP of 'normalising' hate
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi blamed the BJP for the fatal assault on Tripura student Anjel Chakma in Dehradun, calling it a "horrific hate crime" fueled by "toxic content and irresponsible narratives." Chakma succumbed to injuries sustained in a December 9th assault.

title: Man Assaulted At Delhi Airport Questions Aviation Regulator Over "Silence"
content: Ten days after the alleged physical assault at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport Terminal 1, passenger Ankit Dewan has raised pointed questions to the airport operator DIAL, the aviation regulator DGCA.

title: Welcome Top Court Order On Aravalli, Panel Formation: Environment Minister
content: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav on Monday welcomed the Supreme Court's decision to stay its order accepting a uniform definition of the Aravalli hills and ranges, and said the government stands committed to its protection and restoration.

title: "Violating Beyond Words": Kangana Ranaut On Her AI Pics Near Parliament
content: Actor and Member of Parliament Kangana Ranaut strongly objected to the circulation of AI-edited images that show her wearing outfits she never wore.

title: Silver Drops Almost 3% From Record Highs, Gold Snaps 4-Day Rally
content: Silver prices retreated from record highs to trade lower by nearly 3 per cent at Rs 2.32 lakh per kg in the futures trade on Monday as investors booked profits after sharp gains amid weak global trends.

title: 'Won't Rest Until They Get Capital Punishment': Unnao Survivor To NDTV
content: The woman from Uttar Pradesh's Unnao, who was raped by former MLA Kuldeep Singh Sengar, today thanked the Supreme Court for staying the Delhi High Court's verdict that suspended the convicted man's life sentence.

title: Suriname Man Who Killed 9, Including 5 Children, Dies By Suicide In Jail
content: A man suspected of stabbing to death nine people, including five children, in Suriname's capital killed himself in jail, police said Monday.

title: AI, 20,000 Cops: Bengaluru's Security Plan For New Year's Eve
content: With Bengaluru bracing for massive crowds on New Year's Eve, the City Police have announced comprehensive public safety and security measures to ensure smooth and incident-free celebrations.

title: Your "Horrific, Systemic Victimisation": India Hits Back At Pak Over Minority Remarks
content: New Delhi has strongly censured Pakistan's comments on vandalism in India during Christmas, saying Pakistan has an "abysmal record" when it comes to treatment of its minorities.

title: Teachers Won't Be Tasked With Counting Stray Dogs, Delhi Government Clarifies
content: Amid confusion over stray dog-related duties, the Delhi government clarified on Monday that teachers have not been assigned any such work.

title: "Remarks In Jest, Not A Racial Attack": Dehradun Cop On Tripura Student's Death
content: The attack on Tripura student Angel Chakma in Dehradun was not a racial one, a senior police official told NDTV. According to the police, derogatory remarks made "in jest" created the false impression that the student was being targeted.

title: Born Out Of 2024 Bangladesh Protests, Party Loses Leaders Over Jamaat Union
content: The National Citizen Party in Bangladesh has recentlylost prominent faces because of its tie-up with the hardline Jamaat-E-Islami Bangladesh, considered a pro-Pakistan and radical Islamist party.

title: "We Are Indians Too": Father After Tripura Student Killed In 'Racial' Attack
content: Tarun Prasad Chakma, father of Angel Chakma, a student from Tripura who was killed in Dehradun, said that people from the Northeast are Indians too and urged the government to ensure equal treatment.

title: After BMC Poll Deal, Prakash Ambedkar's "Sakuni, Sleeper Cell" Swipe At Congress
content: Vanchit Bahujan Aghadi (VBA) chief Prakash Ambedkar has slammed whom he identified as "sleeper cells" within the Congress, as realignments unfold ahead of the election to the BMC, the country's richest municipal body.

title: "No Flesh Left On Her Body": Father Dead, Woman Found Starving In UP Home
content: A horrific incident has come to light from Uttar Pradesh's Mahoba district, where a retired railway employee and his mentally challenged daughter were held captive and tortured by their caretakers for five years, resulting in the man's death.

title: Prashant Kishor Active Again After Bihar Poll Setback
content: After staying quiet for a while following his party's lacklustre performance in the Bihar Assembly election, Prashant Kishor is once again becoming active in politics.

title: "Vote For BJP, Will Remove Infiltrators": Amit Shah In Assam
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah today reached out to voters in Assam and asked them to give another five years to the BJP in the state. This is needed in order to push back illegal infiltrators from Assam and the rest of the country, he said.

title: Pawar Family Reunites For Pune Civic Polls: "Only Because Workers Wanted It"
content: After weeks of speculation, the Pawars have officially reunited in their bastions of Pune and Pimpri-Chinchwad. The decision comes nearly a fortnight before the Mumbai civic polls.

title: 'Proud Indian Dehumanised, Then Killed': Shashi Tharoor On Tripura Student
content: Senior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor today condemned the allegedly racially motivated killing of a Tripura student in Dehradun, calling it a "national disgrace" and a failure of society to respect its own diversity.

title: "We Are Not Momo": Nagaland Minister On Tripura Student's Killing
content: Nagaland Minister Temjen Imna Along on Monday strongly reacted to the alleged racial attack on a Tripura student in Dehradun, asserting that the North Eastern states are an inseparable and integral part of India.

title: Thorny Issues In '90% Done' Ukraine Deal: Takeaways From Trump-Zelensky Meet
content: US President Donald Trump and his Ukrainian counterpart, Volodymyr Zelensky, held a high-stakes meeting in Florida on Sunday. The two leaders aimed to push forward negotiations to end the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: 38th edition of Hyderabad Book Fair concludes, draws 16 lakh visitors
content: Organisers describe the response as one of the strongest in recent years, noting a particularly encouraging turnout of young readers

title: Iranna Kadadi meets Om Birla on behalf of Belagavi administration
content: Earlier, a Maharashtra MP complained to the Speaker against the Deputy Commissioner after a prohibitory order was passed against him

title: Free sparsha darshan for Chenchus on Vaikunta Ekadasi in Srisailam
content: Chenchus will be allowed to enter through the queue line at the Old Donation Counter from 11 a.m., says temple management

title: DGP calls for greater awareness among public to prevent cybercrimes like digital arrest
content: Police handled over 62,000 complaints related to cybercrimes and registered 2,332 cases while public lost ₹815 crore in the offences in 2025, says Harish Kumar Gupta

title: Stress on universities, scientists to work together to help farmers
content: The National Agricultural Development Cooperative Limited, Baramulla, J&K, is coordinating an international conference at UAS in Raichur

title: Sabarimala temple to open for Makaravilakku festival on Tuesday
content: A large influx of devotees, particularly from the neighbouring States, is expected during the period

title: Telugu States bag major share of Vaikuntha Ekadasi darshan tokens at Tirumala
content: With the TTD introducing the e-dip random allotment system for the first time, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana account for most successful applicants, indicating higher awareness of the transparent, system driven process

title: Arrangements in place at temples for festive rush in Chittoor, Anantapur districts
content: Kanipakam temple likely to witness huge devotee rush on Vaikunta Ekadasi (December 30), Vaikunta Dwadasi (December 31) and on New Year (January 1); temple management halts ‘Antaralaya Darshanams’ for the three days to facilitate darshan to more number of devotees

title: Bird flu source remains unclear in Kuttanad despite repeated outbreaks
content: A study by Kerala Agricultural University (KAU), in collaboration with NGOs and the State Wetland Authority Kerala (SWAK), finds no direct evidence linking migratory birds to the bird flu outbreak reported in Alappuzha, Kottayam and Pathanamthitta districts in 2024. The findings are based on waterbird monitoring conducted between January and April 2024.

title: Killing of Tripura student in Dehradun a horrific ‘hate crime’: Rahul Gandhi
content: “Hate doesn’t appear overnight. For years now, it is being fed daily — especially to our youth — through toxic content and irresponsible narratives. And it’s being normalised by the hate-spewing leadership of the ruling BJP,” Rahul Gandhi said

title: Congress has split into two; it’s Priyanka versus Rahul camps now, says BJP
content: Shehzad Poonawalla alleged that the split in the Congress has come out in the open after senior party leader Digvijaya Singh praised the BJP and the RSS

title: Churches in focus as Christmas violence threatens BJP’s political calculus ahead of Assembly elections
content: Deepika, the mouthpiece of the Syro-Malabar Church, does not hold back its criticism of the Prime Minister in an editorial published on Monday

title: CPI(M) blames Congress-BJP stoked caste and religion identity politics for its poor showing in the local body polls
content: CPI(M) State secretary M.V. Govindan claims that the LDF, weighed down by nearly 10 years of incumbency, defied political gravity by significantly increasing its vote share in the local body polls compared to the 2024 Lok Sabha polls

title: Andhra Pradesh sets up task force to strengthen infectious disease control
content: 24-member panel to frame prevention strategy, oversee rapid response and review outbreaks every three months across the State

title: Capacity augmentation project of Mysuru station on track
content: The city station is among the 48 in India that have been identified for expansion of coaching terminals

title: Emotions run high in Andhra Pradesh Cabinet over Annamayya district headquarters issue
content: Transport Minister breaks down during discussions on shifting headquarters from Rayachoti as Chief Minister assures district-level development and administrative balance

title: Tribal body seeks trial in Anjel Chakma murder case outside Uttarakhand
content: The All India Chakma Students’ Union also demanded a probe by the Central Bureau of Investigation, citing lapses by the State police and hospital authorities

title: Namma Metro, BMTC extend late-night services for New Year’s Eve revellers in Bengaluru
content: The BMRCL also announced that the last train from Nadaprabhu Kempegowda Station, Majestic, will depart at 2.45 a.m. towards all four directions, Whitefield and Challaghatta on the Purple Line, and Madavara and Silk Institute on the Green Line

title: The best Malayalam films of 2025: ‘Lokah’, ‘Eko’, ‘Ronth’, ‘Ponman’ and more
content: Even considering the glut of some below-par work, these films kept the industry in good standing, both commercially and artistically

title: People wrongly accuse me of appeasement; I am secular in true sense, says Mamata Banerjee
content: The West Bengal CM was speaking at the foundation stone laying ceremony of ‘Durga Angan’, a cultural complex dedicated to Goddess Durga, at New Town in Kolkata

title: Actor Jayasurya interrogated in investment fraud case
content: The actor was questioned for several hours over his suspected links to the alleged multi-crore Save Box Bidding App investment fraud.

title: How transformative was 2025 for higher education in India?
content: India’s higher education system crossed a pivotal threshold, where regulatory reforms sought to align closely with market realities, expanded student choices, and integrated global opportunities

title: NCB files chargesheet in alleged darknet-based drug trafficking case
content: The enforcement agency had seized 1,127 suspected LSD (lysergic acid diethylamide) blots, 131.66 g of Ketamine, and crypto assets worth ₹90 lakh during the operation conducted in June.

title: BJP wants all infiltrators ejected from India: Amit Shah in Assam
content: The Home Minister addressed a crowd after inaugurating the redeveloped Batadrava Than, the birthplace of saint-reformer Srimanta Sankaradeva in Nagaon district

title: Special Roll Observer faces public ire in Bengal SIR hearing venue
content: Eyewitness accounts said that a group of local protestors, led by the TMC-run Zilla Parishad president Mujibar Rahaman Mollah, gheraoed the special observer and demanded that the party’s Booth Level Agents-2 be allowed entry at the hearing sessions

title: Union Minister of State for Coal chairs review meeting on NLCIL’s operational performance and growth plans
content: Satish Chandra Dubey, who was on a two-day visit to NLCIL on December 27 and 28, lauded the company’s significant contributions to the nation’s energy security and economic development

title: Teachers demanding equal pay for equal work detained again in Chennai
content: The teachers have been protesting since Friday (December 26, 2025) to highlight a long-standing pay disparity

title: Amit Shah unveils new Guwahati Police Commissionerate building, city surveillance system
content: The building will house all branches of Guwahati Police and will have a seating capacity for 400 officers, besides a library and an archive

title: Kochi Mayor promises corruption-free governance, to hold public hearings
content: She says a special drive will be conducted to collect tax dues without overburdening citizens to ensure the Corporation’s financial stability

title: Selvaperunthagai slams Praveen Chakravarty’s ‘T.N. debt level’ remark; files complaint with AICC
content: Mr. Chakravarty on Sunday disputed the claim of DMK Parliamentary party leader Kanimozhi, that the M.K. Stalin government had transformed the debt-burdened Tamil Nadu into a developed State

title: ED conducts searches in Delhi, Haryana in coercive private loan settlements case
content: Investigations were initiated based on more than 15 FIRs and chargesheets filed by the police in Haryana and U.P. against the accused, ‘a known strongman involved in criminal activities like murder, extortion, coercive settlements of loans...’, the ED stated

title: ‘Bulldozer politics’ row: Kerala CM takes on Karnataka over Bengaluru eviction drive
content: The statements of Kerala CM and AICC general secretary after an eviction drive in Bengaluru are seen as part of a narrative building exercise ahead of Assembly elections in Kerala expected early next year.

title: Kochi Mayor unveils 50-day action plan ahead of Assembly polls
content: V.K. Minimol says action plan will aim at finding solutions to multiple challenges, including waterlogging, waste management, mosquito eradication, and stray dog menace

title: Keep aside differences, work unitedly with Sena (UBT) to save Mumbai: Raj to MNS cadre
content: "Keep your differences aside to save Mumbai. Party workers and local functionaries must take part in the campaigning of Shiv Sena (UBT) and NCP (SP) candidates, and the same will be reciprocated by the Shiv Sena (UBT)," says Raj Thackeray

title: One dies as overloaded truck mounts divider, topples onto SUV in Uttar Pradesh's Rampur
content: Police from multiple stations, senior officers and fire services were present at the spot to manage rescue and traffic operations

title: Speak up against hate crimes: Sibal to Shah on Tripura student killing
content: The Independent Rajya Sabha MP said the incident was a shocking display of a hate crime, bigotry and the "silence of leaders in government who by their inaction are complicit"

title: S. Ramadoss elected PMK president at party ‘general council’ meeting in Salem
content: The meeting “expelled” Mr. Anbumani’s wife, Sowmiya Anbumani, from the post of president of Pasumai Thaayagam, an environmental wing of the party

title: One-year-old dies after choking on stone in Kerala’s Malappuram
content: The child swallowed several small stones while playing in the courtyard of his house. One of the stones became lodged in his throat, leading to his death

title: Welcome SC order on Aravallis, formation of new panel to study issue: Union Environment Minister
content: As things stand, a complete ban on mining stays with regard to new mining leases or renewal of old mining leases, Bhupender Yadav said

title: Nainar Nagenthran slams DMK govt. over women's safety after alleged sexual assault of seven-year-old girl
content: In a social media post, Mr. Nagenthran said reports of a youth, allegedly under the influence of alcohol, abducting and sexually assaulting the child in Kalugur near Kulithalai were “deeply distressing”

title: Lalit Modi issues apology after ‘biggest fugitives of India’ remark in viral video with Vijay Mallya
content: The apology came days after India said it is committed to bringing back from abroad economic fugitives including Lalit Modi and Mallya to face the law in the country

title: Shah inaugurates ₹227 crore redeveloped birthplace of Srimanta Sankardeva
content: Project has been designed not only make the historic site a major tourist attraction but also to reflect the life, ideals, and artistic heritage associated with Mahapurush Sankardeva and the broader cultural traditions of the State

title: Congress welcomes SC decision to stay ‘100-metre definition’ of Aravallis
content: The Congress has taken a strong opposition against redefinition, expressing it would destroy the hills by opening them to mining, and real estate projects

title: Turmeric exports from Erode district see 5% rise thanks to sustained global demand
content: Known for its high curcumin content ranging between 2.5% and 3.9%, Erode turmeric has earned a Geographical Indication (GI) tag and remains one of the major crops cultivated in the district

title: Malayalam actor Jayasurya appears before ED in FEMA case probe
content: The actor, accompanied by his wife, is understood to have visited the agency's zonal office as part of a Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) case probe

title: Skill Centre to be set up at KBN College within three months: MP Kesineni Sivanath
content: Addressing an alumni meet organised by the KBN College Old Students Association (KOSA), the MP called upon former students settled across India and abroad to actively contribute to Vijayawada’s development

title: AIMIM announces candidates for Thane, Vasai-Virar civic polls
content: “As of now, the party has finalised the names of five candidates from Mumbra in Thane city and three candidates from the Vasai-Virar region,” says AIMIM president Imtiaz Jaleel

title: Coinbase CEO says ex-employee arrested in India
content: Crypto exchange Coinbase’s CEO Brian Armstrong announced on social media that an ex-employee was arrested in India

title: LDF regains Pullur-Periya panchayat in Kerala’s Kasaragod after tie-break decided by lots
content: Draw of lots became necessary as both LDF and UDF secured nine votes each in the election. The tie occurred after an elected member abstained from voting

title: L&T bags order related to Hyderabad Greenfield Radial Road
content: Scope of work involves construction of a 3.6 km long viaduct, minor bridges, underpasses and culverts besides others

title: Unnao rape survivor welcomes SC order staying suspension of Kuldeep Sengar's life sentence
content: The Supreme Court on December 29, stayed the Delhi High Court order that had suspended Sengar's life sentence and granted him bail in the 2017 Unnao rape case

title: Four teenagers held for assaulting Maharashtra man in Tamil Nadu’s Tiruvallur
content: The accused youths filmed the brutal assault and uploaded the videos on social media platforms in an attempt to make them go viral

title: Tezpur University unrest: Stakeholders stage 24-hr hunger strike to mark 100 days of protest
content: A joint forum of all stakeholders demands the removal of the beleaguered VC for his alleged involvement in corruption and other forms of irregularities, and the start of an inquiry into his actions.

title: Kerala local body polls: Agali panchayat president quits after Congress threatens legal action over election with LDF support
content: Elected from Chinnaparamba ward of Agali panchayat on Congress symbol, Manju became president on Saturday with the support of nine LDF members, drawing the ire of UDF

title: 2025: a year of landmark acquittals questioning credibility of terror convictions in India
content: In 2025, courts freed 19 men after years behind bars; Bombay High Court quashed convictions in the 7/11 Mumbai train blasts case, and a special NIA court acquitted all accused in the Malegaon case

title: Ravens-Steelers on SNF to cap Week 18 slate
content: The NFL announced the full final-weekend schedule, with the marquee matchup between the Ravens and Steelers set to take place on "Sunday Night Football" on NBC, with the winner making the playoffs.

title: Purdy 'playing as good as it gets'; 49ers eye 1-seed
content: For the second week in a row, QB Brock Purdy accounted for five touchdowns as the 49ers outlasted the Bears 42-38 in a wild shootout on "Sunday Night Football" to set up a Week 18 showdown with the Seahawks for the NFC's top seed.

title: Kawhi puts up career-high 55 for streaking Clips
content: Kawhi Leonard scored a career-high 55 points as the Clippers extended their winning streak with a victory over the Eastern Conference-leading Pistons.

title: Source: Bears rookie WR Burden has quad injury
content: Bears rookie WR Luther Burden III suffered a quad injury Sunday night that is not thought to be serious, a source told ESPN.

title: Pats clinch AFC East; Bills' reign ends with loss
content: The Patriots clinched their first division title since 2019 on Sunday, dismantling the Jets behind Drake Maye and then watching the Bills fall to the Eagles.

title: Garrett: Steelers' focus more on me than winning
content: Myles Garrett didn't set the NFL's single-season sacks record Sunday, but he believes the Steelers were more worried about preventing his record than getting the win.

title: LeBron, Luka 'set the tone' as Lakers right ship
content: With the Lakers reeling from a three-game slide, a calf injury to Austin Reaves and an air-it-out team meeting coming into Sunday's game against the Kings, LeBron James and Luka Doncic led a dominant 125-101 win to help right the ship for L.A.

title: Tank talk rubs Raiders wrong way amid latest loss
content: Raiders players' displeasure regarding the talk of tanking hovering over the organization intensified after a 34-10 loss to the Giants on Sunday.
